intro: Impatiens loheri, commonly known as the Loher's impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring upright stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, which bloom throughout the rainy season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral characteristics, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
